medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 weeks before current presentation, with initial headache, body aches, sweats, diarrhea, and nausea. Yellowing of the eyes and skin developed one week before the presentation, accompanied by 2 weeks of anorexia, malaise, dark-brown emesis, profuse watery diarrhea, intermittent abdominal cramping, poor sleep, blurry vision, and episodes of forgetfulness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of opioid use disorder, hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, osteoarthritis, depression, and anxiety.
medical_history.social_history: Unemployed and homeless, residing in a shelter. Smoked cigarettes daily for 20 years. Previously consumed 2 liters of vodka daily but quit 6 years prior. Estranged from siblings and had not been sexually active in 2 years.
